summary: The American Grown Act (S. 2504) mandates that specific U.S. federal agencies – the Executive Office of the President, the Department of Defense, and the Department of State – procure cut flowers and cut greens only if they are grown within the United States (including states, territories, and areas under tribal jurisdiction). It also outlines stipulations regarding accepting gifts of foreign-grown flowers and greens, requiring the clear display of origin and the simultaneous procurement of domestically-grown alternatives. The bill aims to support American agriculture.
